entries.meaning: (obsolete, agriculture) A second mowing; the grass which grows after the first crop of hay in the same season.
examples: They were cutting aftermath on all sides, which gave the neighbourhood, this gusty autumn morning, an untimely smell of hay.

entries.meaning: That which happens after, that which follows, usually of strongly negative connotation in most contexts, implying a preceding catastrophe.
examples: In contrast to most projections of the aftermath of nuclear war, in this there is no rioting or looting.
